title: Seoul Says Deal Reached With U.S. to Release Workers Detained in Hyundai Raid
summary: U.S. border czar says such workplace raids will continue, as South Korea says a plane will be sent to repatriate the workers taken into custody in Georgia.

title: West Point Alumni Group Cancels Award Honoring Tom Hanks
summary: The group was to bestow the Sylvanus Thayer Award on the actor, but it said it was canceling the event to focus on preparing academy cadets for the future.

title: The oil tycoons who backed Trump are getting nearly everything they wanted. “We all voted for this.”
summary: The Trump administration has opened land to drilling and is moving to roll back environmental restrictions and hobble renewable energy. But crude prices have dropped.

title: Australian Woman, Erin Patterson, Gets Life in Mushroom Murder Case
summary: Erin Patterson was found guilty of murdering three of her husband’s relatives and trying to kill a fourth by serving them deadly mushrooms.

title: Trump Is Met With Mostly Boos at U.S. Open as Security Delays a Match
summary: With the president in attendance at Arthur Ashe Stadium, the men’s final began as hundreds of people were still waiting to go through security screening.

title: Millions of Londoners Brace for Transit Disruption as Tube Strike Begins
summary: A strike on the London Underground began Sunday over pay and conditions, threatening to upend commuter journeys for most of the week.

title: RFK Jr., Rejecting Vaccine Data, Fuels Distrust of Public Health Agencies
summary: By promoting suspicions about the institutions he oversees, critics say Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is jeopardizing public health. He says he is pursuing transparency.

title: Brazilians Protest as Bolsonaro Coup Trial Nears Verdict
summary: Tensions are heating up in Brazil as the nation enters the final week of former President Jair Bolsonaro’s trial on attempted coup charges.

title: Opinion | A Senate Confirmation Fast Lane?
summary: As obstruction undermines Senate advise and consent, Republicans consider a rule change to speed confirmation of Trump picks.

title: Opinion | Brandon Johnson’s Other Chicago Mess
summary: The school board votes down his payday loan for pension costs.

title: Opinion | ‘War Department’ Is a Good Start
summary: Let’s avoid euphemism and give every agency of government an honest name.

title: Opinion | Do Sports Explain the ‘Math Gender Gap’?
summary: Statistics and other numbers are pervasive in organized athletics.

title: Hyundai Raid Rattles a Hot Spot of Growth in Georgia
summary: Koreans drawn to communities around the carmaker’s complex now wonder if they are welcome.

title: Opinion | Trump’s Risky Game With the Fed
summary: The U.S. built its economic credibility slowly over a long time. Once lost, it won’t be easy to regain.

title: What We Know About the Hyundai-LG Plant Immigration Raid in Georgia
summary: Several hundred workers, most of them South Korean nationals, were detained at the construction site of a sprawling electric vehicle battery plant on Thursday.

title: Trump Downplays Post Threatening Chicago, Saying He Wants to ‘Clean Up’ City
summary: The president had said on social media that Chicago was “about to find out why it’s called the Department of WAR,” drawing a fierce rebuke from Democrats.

title: Houthi Drone Hits Israeli Airport After Warning System Failure
summary: The strike by the Yemeni militants followed the Israeli killing of several of their top leaders a week ago.

title: Russia Strikes Ukraine Government Building in Largest Drone Assault of War
summary: Ukrainians said it was the first time a key building in Kyiv’s government district had been damaged since the war began. Russia has kept attacking despite Trump administration efforts at peace talks.

title: A Town Reluctantly Let a Mosque Expand. Then Came the Backlash.
summary: A Long Island town board failed to approve a settlement its lawyers had struck with Masjid Al-Baqi after a yearslong dispute tainted by bigotry. The mosque’s federal suit will be heard next month.

title: Chicago on Edge After Threats of ICE Raids
summary: President Trump is threatening the third-largest U.S. city with “Chipocalypse Now” and mass deportations.

title: Opinion | America’s ‘Buy Now, Pay Later’ Economy
summary: Signs of an emerging debt crisis are everywhere—from credit cards and mortgages to government budgets.

title: Egypt-Israel Tensions Rise Over Attack on Gaza City
summary: A large-scale Israeli assault on the city in northern Gaza could push hundreds of thousands of Palestinians southward toward Egypt’s border.

title: Immigration Raid Exposes Tensions From Seoul to Washington to Rural Georgia
summary: The raid at a Georgia plant being built with heavy investment from South Korea reveals strain as a rush to expand manufacturing in the United States clashes with an immigration crackdown.

title: ‘If I Live to 25, I’ve Lived a Good Life’
summary: He started fighting wildfires as a teenager. After inhaling smoke on the front lines for six seasons, he faced an impossible choice.

title: Alleged Chinese cyber-espionage campaigns were timed to potentially deploy spyware against organizations giving input on President Trump’s trade negotiations
summary: The FBI is investigating a scheme to spy on trade groups using fake emails from China committee chair Rep. John Moolenaar.

title: A Six-Story Apartment Building Is Tearing This Small California Town Apart
summary: A community in Marin County is struggling to comply with state mandates for more housing; ‘When you move to a small town, you don’t come to live with a tower.’

title: Why Are More Older People Dying After Falls?
summary: Some researchers suspect that rising prescription drug use may explain a disturbing trend.

title: Russia Steps Up Disinformation Efforts as Trump Abandons Resistance
summary: The Kremlin has begun a campaign to sway the parliamentary election in Moldova in what could become a new model of election interference online.

title: Stop Acting Like This Is Normal
summary: Democrats aren’t powerless, and they don’t have to enable autocracy.

title: The Future Is Flag Football
summary: Flag football offers girls as well as boys a means of enjoying the sport without the risk of brain damage.

title: Trump has so far stood by RFK Jr., the health and human services secretary, as he moves to dismantle public health institutions and overhaul U.S. vaccine policy
summary: Kennedy’s disruption of the CDC, vaccine recommendations and other policies drew a Senate rebuke. Trump is standing by him, for now.

title: A Mysterious Death Casts a Shadow Over Burning Man
summary: This year’s desert arts and music event reached a fever pitch before a Russian man was found in a pool of his own blood. Authorities said his death is being treated as a homicide.

title: On College Campuses, Students Weigh the Risk of Resistance
summary: University administrations are under pressure from the Trump administration to discourage pro-Palestinian demonstrations.
